name: Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies
description: Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies is a Free to Play MMOFPS offering competitive PvP and PvE action including content from the original Counter-Strike and all new game modes, maps, weapons, and hordes of Zombies!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 or later Processor: Intel(R) Pentium® 4 CPU 2.80GHz or higher Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce 6xxx or higher DirectX: Version 9.0c Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 5 GB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 10 Processor: Intel(R) Core™2 Duo CPU E4xxx or higher Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce 8xxx or higher DirectX: Version 9.0c Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 10 GB available space

reviews.review_text: How to not make a video game:  -Make one team super OP -Use a 17 year old game engine -Add microtransactions -Add crafting (as opposed to actually getting a weapon) -Make craftable weapons only last a few days -Make everything overpriced -Put in tons of camping locations -Re-use content from a 10 year old game -Your zombie is an octagon (I wish I was joking) -Pretend it's a horror game -Foggify old maps to pretend they are new -Make a crappy sound play every time someone dies -Use an over-saturated game idea -License a completely unrelated series -Put your company name in the title -Make it 2GB, because that's the size a game from 17 years ago is supposed to be, right? -Make the menus incredibly hard to understand -Make it free to play  And have fun, your crappy game is complete.
Free might be too much for this game.
Play it not for the zombies, but because you can play oldschool CS 1.6 for free.

I feel as though this game had potential, but it wasn't used and overall I feel the game had poor design. While I would say if you didn't have 1.6 this could be an alternative given the team deathmatch mode, there are changes in movement and physics that really mess it up. It should have been made in the CS:GO engine for improved graphics and other things (you don't need much to run CS:GO anyway) and I don't think it should really be a standalone game. It is just a mod.   I played Zombie Escape which involved me following arrows on a map which looked open - but turned out to be very linear, just the same thing every round. It was an ok concept for a game/gamemode, but it lacked any enjoyment for me - and I sometimes found myself stuck in the walls of the map, just waiting for my demise. Then it happened as a zombie, and I couldn't do anything - so I quit the server.  So this review doesn't go on forever, here are my pros and cons about the game:  PROS:  -The game is free so you don't waste any money trying it out (unless you use the microtransactions...) -Some good concepts for gamemodes which could be improved and expanded upon more   CONS:  -Some people don't like free to play - so I'm putting that here too.  -Microtransactons -COD-Style Levelling  -Bugs (Stuck in walls, game not starting correctly to name a few) -Made in the 1.6 engine rather than using something more up-to-date -Linear arrow following in what could have easily been a more expansive world to play in -Movement changes from 1.6 make it somewhat unfamiliar to 1.6 players -Gets repetitve quickly -It could easily have just been a mod, and some of the gamemodes are probably playable in Gmod - YOU DON'T MOVE FASTER WITH YOUR KNIFE OUT   Overall I would say this game is a 4/10 as it's features are rather lackluster. I feel as though Nexon have let us down, as I was somewhat looking forward to this game when I first heard about it. These are just my opinions though, and as the game is free you can try it out if you would like.

CSNZ It's CS with Zombies, Crafting kinda like having all cheat codes turned on at times well in the zombie modes anyways.  There's lots of Guns, Maps & Game Modes A Free DLC pack & Even BINGO!  I have played more than 200hrs and have never found the need to buy anything and people do tend to share. I feel that I can say that this Is a REAL F2P. It is a complete game at download.   There is however a few 'Cons' I thought the real down side was the the community.Acting rude and just all around not very kind to the new players. all almost as if some of the higher ranks think they just just started the game out at Lv100 the term 'noob' hugely over used and been around for a long time but its used like a little kid just learn a new cool word that all the popular kids use. I mean come on people give'um a brake the game isn't that grate there is other game out there. i made this conclusion at around 300hrs of game play.   Make as many friends as you can as you move up through the ranks and or bring some with you and I don't see why anyone who likes FPS's & ZOMBIES wouldn't have a good time playing.

EDIT 2: Forewarning that impacts my review heavily: They've both removed a permanent item from my iventory** *and* my review was edited with that message being deleted. I've contacted Valve and they won't do it. Most large review sites only accept paid news articles. TotalBiscuit even refused it.   This will be a more serious review as it has the Counter Strike/F2P 'click-bait' name to it. To put it simply, it's a Combat Arms Pay2Win/F2P first person shooter. It has parts of it that are entertaining and parts of it that are abysmal, even worse than CA. Calling it CS is far from the truth.  Most of the modes suck outside of about 2. I recommend their equivalent of Gun Games called Gun Deathmatch (for balance), and the Zombie Scenario: Tracking (if you're interested in purely killing thiings mindlessly). Every other game mode is imbalanced and P2W-favored. The guns are weak unless you pay money or use cheats. Did I mention they use the notorious 'Anti-Hack Shield'? It's useless if you're new to it. I'm not saying everyone cheats, it's just a useless system. There are no fidelity options, the game looks like s***. That's sorta a good thing because even bad computers easily push high FPS. But it looks like it was ported from PS2; it's bad. And the low reqs of it cause a lot of game ruiners to play. And no one talks on this game - text or mic. It's by far the leas strategic FPS I've seen and played, both due to gameplay and that communication issue.  It's the best F2P first-person shooter out there, to be honest. But that isn't saying much.. Even if you're very poor, I urge you to pay money for a game that doesn't suck. It definitely isn't worth playing. I left out some key points to keep this shorter, I just hope I prevents people from making the mistake of installing this. I cannot believe Valve backed it or it's called Counter Strike.... I suppose you can't expect much out of Nexon anyway.

It's basically  Counter-Strike 1.6  (♥) with slightly improved graphics and gameplay (I really like the crosshair with a dot in the middle) and elements from the famous  Zombie Plague  mode, merged with a pay-2-win shop system that  really  reminds me of  Wolf Team  (and other similar games).   Yeah, there's a shop system in this game...  ...but I'm not going to be a whiny bitᴄh about it (check most of the non-recommended reviews), because I'm not forced to spend money on this, since I can just play on regular 1.6-style servers with all the original characters and weapons.   A thing that did annoy me about this game is the removal of tons of console commands and the ability to have an own user config (the famous 'autoexec.cfg') is gone, but I think this can be added in future updates.  ---  Edit  --- I'd like to add that I'm not mad at the shop system: weapons can be crafted so easily without spending real life money (there's even a chance of getting permanent items) and the only 'pay2win' aspect of the game are some crappy female skins with irritating death sounds that you can quickly frag. Yes, there's people who waste money on that (well, Nexon has to make some profit somehow).
Couldn't even join a server.  Thank God.

These trailers make most companies presentations at E3 look truthful.  Expectation: Large detailed maps. Epic battles between survivors and the ravenous horde. Varied content. Lots of player customization with weapons and costumes.  Reality: Every map I played was 'run from point A to point B'. Thanks to this, i now understand 'rush B, silver style'. The only people i ever saw shoot were the ones who just started the game. (see complaint #1.) At least there isn't anything interesting to distract you as you run. Any item you find or buy is only usable for a limited time, after which it dissapears into subspace.  Conclusion: I would say there is only one way to quit the game, but the gun you had just dissapeared.

Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies is a fifteen year old shooter Counter Strike 1.6 packed with some new modes and, of course, a bunch of zombies. Its a decent game. The zombies are way too many to kill. Some of the maps has too little places for humans to hide from these zombies. I believe that the game need to make the zombies walk much slower and are able to have their body parts come off with enough damage to do so. Also got lvling system which is a new feature for CS 1.6.

Pros: Classic 1.6 and many different modes Many new weapons and character models Tons of PvE and PvP  Cons: Menu UI Balancing issues Minor details to certain game modes (More detail below)  I feel this game is a great addition to the CS games, it not only has the original CS1.6 mode, but has tons of new weapons that you can craft and many different multiplayer modes to chose from and some great CO-OP. Though not as fun alone, when you have these people called 'friends' it makes for a great experience. Though yes some improvements can be made, such as a round start timer for the original mode (I haven't seen one myself), less structure health on Tracking mode, the hidden should be more like source, where he remains only slightly visible and you have to watch for certain things to find him, and plus no respawns in that mode (Reason I mention the hidden stuff there is because it makes it way to fast pace). Anyways thats my 2 cents on this game. Play for yourself, everyones opinion is there own... even if its wrong :D  I forgot to mention that the Menu UI is terrible and needs to be the same as the in game video settings. Also there should be more resolution settings (such as 1360x768 for me).  (If there are other things I feel need to be here I'll edit it in.)

Hi Everone. Please check out my profile for more reviews. :D   This game is a very terrible copy of the originaly Counter Strikes. It adds zombies in which look like pixels with high quality, runs on an 'I need money! Help the producers today!' engine. Realistically, if you enjoy Ace of Spades or Black Ops 2 survival horde mode, this may be your thing. However, once the virus is started, it takes over a clip of ammo to kill a zombie. Note that most of the time, the maps that you play in are short ranged. So, yeah, you're kinda screwed when they attack you at close range.     The headshots seem to do nothing, the pictures on the title that actually look realistic are fake, and once you made you died several times, for some reason, most people on the server dislike you. I don't understand why this couldn't be improved, but the only thing I truely enjoy about the entire game altogether is that you get to play Counter Strike 1.6 for free. But I already have it. In fact, I have all of them. And I have enough experience with games to notice that this is a poorly made game.    The horde mode/base protection, whatever you want to call it, is actually fun. Untill you get to level 11. You need at least 7 team members to survive through it, and all of them (hopefully) have to be really good players. The glitches are terrible with all of the spawn of 'zombies' (I geuss the developers thought those bunches of pixels looked like zombies) around every corner. I ran towards a zombie with full Level 9 health (135 health) and when it hit me (it was a normal one), I died immediately, resulting in a long length of impatience staring at my screen.   Sadly, the others are quite messed up as well. The graphics are just like some crap was smothered and then handed to the online players and makes them believe it looks truly 'realistic'. I appreciate the time that Nexon put into this game, since, if order and layed out correctly, it would have been a good game, but, once again, unfortunately, we have some poorly coded AI units that run around you at random directions and use their weak meelee multiple times, making you overpowered.   Thanks for reading this, and all in all, I procede to announce this review with a 6/10, which, in my book, is quite bad. Note that this was made a few months after the release, so hopefully (even though they probably won't) the company that developed this game in three minutes flat will realize, 'Oh, wait, this is a crappy game,' and improve it throughout the further updates.    Again, thanks for reading this, and check out my profile for more reviews on popular games.

Well, now that i have wasted an hour of my life playing this game to give a proper review, I will write my review. PLEASE NOTE: This is a beta review, my complaints could change, but I don't see that happening since this is Nexon we are talking about. Yes I am aware that this is in beta testing right now, but that is why I reviewing it, to help Nexon (if they choose to do so) fix their game. ALSO NOTE: I love Counter-Strike, all of them. So this negative review is not based on my liking of CS. Now, on to the review.   For starters, this game is Pay to Win up the booty, which is just not fine for any type of CS title, even if it is created by a different company. Every weapon you get dissapears after so long, so have fun spending your time on a weapon that will last half as long.  Second is Sounds, and good lordy, are the sounds hilariously bad. I actually had played this with my friend so I didn't experience the pain by myself. While we were playing, we first joined a lobby and were thrown into a cluster-duck of dumb, bland zombie moans, an announcer that sounds infected repeating 'the zombies will return' and things similar to that, and a guy on the radio calling in a supply drop, but the guy calling it in sounded like he just had his testicles squished in between to hammers. In the span of those 5 seconds, I was crying with laughter because of all of the insanity of sounds.  Now for the gameplay, which isn't much better. Yes, there is a classic mode, which is just CTs against the Ts, but that can't even save this game from the endless and yet almost identical gametypes with zombies. Just to kill a single zombie, (depending on what game type you are on, on some the zombies are litterally impossible to kill) it takes about 2 clips from an m4, which is way too much to kill a single zombie, as opposed to the zombies' one-hit kill with the secondary melee. Not exactly fair. As far as graphics, I don't ever honestly care about graphics, so long as they aren't painful to look at, but unfortunately, I found many textures that were just plain ugly and painful to look at in this game. I love classic graphics, but there is a difference between classic and just plain bad. Also, I guess I should mention that there are AI zombie modes, but its like a modded Killing Floor server that gives you too much money, and with really stupid zombie AI, and by 'stupid' I mean walking into walls, walking past you, etc.  Wow, my fingers hurt, so I am going to say one more thing, if you like this game, goody for you. I am not saying it is wrong for a person to like this game. I mean, this is classic Counter-Strike with zombies! But sadly, they did everything wrong with the concept of CS with zombies in my opinion.  My final verdict would be a 3/10, since it is free, and it is Counter-Strike, and I wish i could love this game like I wanted to, but this was just not what I, or many others, wanted. If Nexon could make this game more like-able, then someone please let me know when they do, I will gladly play this to change my review and update it if it is positively, dramaticly changed, but this was just a huge let-down.

Do yourself a favor and avoid this game, this is not like CounterStrike at all.   I've played CS:1.6 and CS:CZ which are very good games and worth the asking price. This on the other hand is if you took those two games and mixed them with Battlefield Play4Free, and then took a huge dump on it. The User Interface is all over the place and can be hard for new players to understand how to use it, and it litters you with all kinds of promotions and ads for items in the game. Although, once you finally understand how to navigate your way through the insane UI, you will quickly find out that it really is just a butchered version of CS:1.6 with micro transactions all over the place. The re-desings of the old CS maps are not all that great, everything feels way larger than it should feel and the new alternate versions of the maps are really nothing special. The audio is also like CS:1.6, only louder and in lower quality, even with all the audio options set to maximum.    Now for the big one, that being the zombie mode. To put it simply... it's very bad. It really feels like nothing more but the original zombie mod from all the other CS games, and dumbed down to it's simplest form. Either, run away from the zombies with no tactics or pre thinking what so ever, or run around shooting the zombies with no tactics or team work what so ever, and the zombie shelter mode is just so boring, with no pun intended, brain dead zombie ai walking around aimlessly while your turrets fill them with holes and send them back to their boring hell where they belong, or to heven if they are lucky enough.    Not to mention that this version of CounterStrike has no modding features what so ever, because all the events are actually rooms instead of independent servers. Instead, you choose from a couple main servers depending on your geographical location in real life. Because you know, CounterStrike was never known for all of it's mods and community made game modes it has.(To anyone who doesn't understand, that last sentence was sarcasm.) I really am trying to find somthing good about to say about this game, other than you can choose from female characters, which is good. But saddly you can only get those if you give them 9.99 USD, which completely destroyed any positives or upcommings for this game. There are some other things I forgot to mention like crafting and perks, but I have to be honest with you, I really couldn't bare anymore than fourty minutes with this game. Come to think about it, I would have probably have never heard about this game if it weren't for a Youtube I saw while watching a video. I wouldn't have even bothered with it if it weren't for the fact that it was a 'Free to Play' version of CounterStrike.   My final words to you are, if you think this is the Free to Play version of CounterStrike that you have been all waiting for, it really isn't, not even close. If you want to play CounterStrike, then buy any of the other CS games there are, but don't waste your time on this. I hate to say it but, this game is a disgrace to the CounterStrike community.   3/10 not recommended unless you are really looking for a Free to Play First Person Shooter.

This game... Imagine if you will, beating your head against the wall, over and over and over. And then you mostly have the contents of this game.  Based off CS 1.6 this game forces you to kill boxes, with many thousands of hitpoints, 15,000-30,000, and this was pretty unbearable, but then imagine that the makers decided that having the amount of damage dealt to these boxes scales down with the amount of people in the game. When you eventually get to a 'boss' it is simply one of the aforementioned boxes that does an insignificant amount of damage per attack, but suddenly will use it instant kill move. To give perspective, it can use this move with no consequence, no warning, and no escape, even right as you respawn it can do it.   The makers of this game clearly thought that harder difficulty=higher amount of enemy health, and even on easy difficulty this game is a rediculous waste of time, that will bore you to pieces while you shoot boxes blocking the path.

If you're looking for an improved version of Counter-Strike 1.6 then you have found it. At the moment, there are only a few mods available - Standard(like normal CS 1.6 pub servers), Deathmatch, Zombiemod. You are given the choice to pay for cool weapons with real-life money but you really don't have to as you get awarded with weapons everyday you play. In competitive(pub or deathmatch) AK47 is still the best weapon. In zombie-mod there are supply box drops which give you paid weapons for that round for free.  I would say that the only thing missing in this game are the following mods: War3, War3 + ZM, War3 + DM, SuperHero, SuperHero + DM.  I hope Nexon is reading this and will add the mods I mentioned above because then there will be absolutely no reason to play Counter-Strike 1.6.  Also, unlike Counter-Strike 1.6 decals on client-side match server-side so you can aim pretty accurately.  Overall rating: 9/10. If the mods mentioned above get implemented then this is totally 10/10.  FYI: This game is not pay2win, you can pay for weapons but its not required. This is a free game, Nexon has to pay for the hosting and other stuff somehow.

Great Game with lots of different ways you can play; Defeat seemingly endless waves of zombies in 'Zombie Scenario' with never before seen content, featuring pursuit style, and survival/arena style, story based gamemodes. Survive the hordes of the night and scavenge for materials to upgrade your defences in the hard 1-4(co-op) or 4-8(team vs team) gameplay styles of 'Zombie Shelter'. Be the Hero with exclusive weapons or the be Zombie with exclusive skills in 'Zombie Hero' and 'Zombie Mutant', survive against former friends as they are turned into zombies, or become a zombie and infect your friends... Or if you want to follow the original story behind the Zombie Scenario play as Soi in the 'Zombie Files' and discover the real reasons why/what happened.  Or you can play the normal gamemodes with New or Altered maps; (Team) GunDeathmatch with never before seen weapons. Deathmatch or Bot Deathmatch Team Deathmatch or Bot Team Deathmatch or you can choose to play the original style modes of bomb planting, VIP assasination, or 'rescue the hostage' gamemode styles. And you can also play Basic a game mode in which you have unlimited cash and every terrorist has a default bomb to plant, but like original, after you die you have to wait till the next round before you can rejoin... 'Basic' is an easier version of original in my opinion....  OR You can play Human vs Human or rather human vs (bot) human in this Zombie scenario styled game mode which instead of facing off against zombies, you face off against human (bots, not actual online players) and their fiendish schemes  another gamemode available to play is 'FUN' literally called 'FUN', this gamemode has a variety of random minigames that you can play, for example hide'n'seek is adapted to the game so that one player becomes invisible and has to try and take down the other players using only a melee weapon, this sound OP and it kinda' is except for the negative buff that the 'hidden' player recieves: on the odd occasion when the hidden has dealt damage or has been damaged it will become visible for a short time...  'Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies' is in many ways harder and easier than your normal 'C.S:G.O.' or 'C.S Warzone' but I for one know firsthand that it is a great game and is one that I would dedicate myself to unconditionally...

Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies - it's old-school FPS, besides CS Nexon: Zombies will not be very advanced in terms of graphics, game modes will be similar to the classic CS. 7 game modes planned with zombies. One such option some sort of story mode - which gradually turns into a mutant with mutated skills. Another version of the script - a story of people who are fleeing from zombies. Of course, in the game there will be a regime of PVP, PVE, 16 to 16 will be randomly mode when someone will become a zombie, and then infect all.  Game mode of human and zombie is different in a graphical display. The cards will be taken from both the classic Counter-Strike, and added new ones. Choose for whom it is you want to play as a zombie or human, can be from the beginning. Zombies can jump high, can fly and have other qualities which distinguish them from people. The game will be a division into floors, ie are both female and male characters. Some content in the game will be paid, although it will be available during any Event at the game.

(Wonder why I give it a positive rating? Read the whole review.) This game pisses me off. It's almost a pay to win game, I say almost because you can still obtain the rarer guns just by logging in and completing some missions. However, the 'Points' system still hinders you to where you need to grind like a motherfu*ker to get the sufficant points to GET A CHANCE to get the 'good guns'. With the crafting system comes weapons that do nothing and weapons that are literally a godsend, even if you have a godgun, it runs on a temporary system, meaning YOU HAVE LIMITED DAYS TO USE THE GUN. Yes there are 72 day-Pernament materials but it's very rare to get OR you can pay for it.  Another thing that pisses me off is how SLOW it takes to level up. I almost clocked in a day AND i played the OBeta and i'm a level 7. Sure there are EXP Cupons and EXP Boost weekends, but the time it takes to reach these levels are horrendus, especually when you get a crate that you can't open because of your low level.  To add to the hard time it takes to rank up, you can be disconected from the current server your playing on! Even if you have a good connection, it's still possible that you can be disconnected, and once you do, YOU DO NOT GET XP AND LOOT DROPS. It's punishing when you play for a good hour on a zombie senario mission to get some points to craft a weapon you want, and you disconnect randomly for no reason, RIGHT BEFORE THE BOSS DIES. This happened to me more than 10 times now. I've checked my ping, and it was locked at around 30.  Another thing that just urkes my ♥♥♥♥ is when I'm playing zombie hero type modes, and it takes forever to kill the enemy zombies. I understand if the first few zombies need 7000 HP, so they can infect others, however, this becomes an issue because most of the guns can't match the Zombies HP, meaning most of the LMG's and like 1 assault rifle is useful! Pistols, shotguns, and sniper rifles are almost useless, I say almost because guns do slow enemies, some even knock back so it can buy you time. ANOTHER thing that gets annoying is the announcer voice in Zombie Hero mode, it says 'The Zombies Will Be Back' EVERY TIME SOMEONE DIES, which means YOU HEAR THAT MOTHER♥♥♥♥A 32 TIMES MAX.   However...  I still keep coming back. Why, you may ask? Well, even with all of these issues, i'm still hooked. It reminded me of the good ol' times on consoles with private matches on CoD and some servers on CS:S. The gameplay is addicting, you want to survive and fight the hoards of enemies with your friends, and finish the fight with a raid boss. You want badass weapons that your friends have, so you keep fighting the issues to obtain the items needed to craft the weapon. There are enchantments to make your guns and even your zombie character (ZH Mode) even better. There are different species of zombies, and each come with different abilities. You can join a 'family' (A clan, basically) and interact with them and play with them. There are ranked modes, and you have a sperate rank in seperate modes, so you can brag who's better according to ranks. And finally, the game comes with a free CS 1.6. Yeah, a free CS 1.6.  Honestly, I can only complain but in the end it's your choice to try it out or not. I'm giving it a positive rating because first of all, it's free to play, and second, I want you to experience the game itself, and from there you can say if the game blows or not. Much like movie critics, someone can say it sucks, and they maybe right, but who knows if you like it until you watch it.  This game isn't perfect, but still worth a shot.

Now you're thinking: 'Nexon? Zombies? Free Counter-Strike? Awful.' And I guarantee to you that this game isn't what you're thinking, so please hear this review out. The asthetic of the game is obviously not appealing, it's rather generic and downright awful, but if you actually check the game out, you'd find that it's literally just Counter-Strike 1.6 with a lot of unneeded crap. Whether or not you like this unneeded crap is up to you. If you don't want this unneeded crap, you can get rid of it. Here's a console command to remove the costumes from your view: 'cl_minmodels 1'. No quotations. All the characters will stay as classic Counter-Strike. There are also new weapons added into the game, they're not overpowered and are perfectly balanced. If you don't want them, simply join a classic game. Host a game and set weapons to 'Classic Only'. You can also change the HUD so you won't see 'x KILL' or the score counter. With these options, you pretty much got yourself classic Counter-Strike 1.6 for free!  That being said, the rest of the game isn't very good. The ranking system is pointless and extremely time-wasting. The crafting system is random albiet not terrible. The UI is hard to get used to and very clunky. The game is sometimes a b*tch to get launched but not for everyone. The only good game modes are Gun Game, Team Deathmatch, and Classic, although I have a guilty pleasure for 'Item Battle' in FUN mode. The Scenario modes are attrocious with braindead A.I., hitscan enemy accuracy, barriers that take way to long to destroy in order to progress, and horrendously long and generic boss fights. The cosmetics and costumization is abysmal and are beyond awful. So this whole game isn't perfect, by any means.  Although, I can't help but reccomend this because of the fact that this has the classic Counter-Strike package, along with other features you may even like. Most people on Steam have Counter-Strike but for those who don't, this is the perfect substitute.

After playing Counter Strike Nexon: Zombies I decided to write a review for it.  Now this game is essentially Counter strike 1.6, With the exact same engine and gameplay however you can craft new guns and most likely pay for them with micro transaction pretty soon. This 'game' plays like CS should but the only difference is that you get a built in zombie mode which makes this 'game' seem more like a mod for CS. So if you already own Counter strike 1.6 there is little reason to play this version. Even though the game is named Zombies, In my opinion the zombie mode is the worst game mode in the game, With boring and repetitive gameplay such as destory this baracide that has increased amount of health than the last 3 you destoryed while you are being horded by the same zombies that seem to only be able to do around about 10 health in damage each swing(If they even bother).  Once the game gets out of Beta or gets a big update Ill expand on this review until then I would stay away from this game as it is actually a direct copy of Nexon's other game called Counter Strike Online but with a few new maps and thats it.

I've spent an hour looking at the zombie gamemodes they feel almost the same except for zombie escape which is still terrible. The best game I have ever played in twenty years of computer gaming, bar none (and I have played a LOT of games). Eight years on I can still recall how profoundly that game gripped me, and I am not an overly emotional person. You will care about the characters, you will be moved, you will make choices that tell you more about yourself. It sounds trite, I know, but it really is that good. If only someone would make more of these...insightful, intelligent, devastatingly creative. Fallout is the only RPG to come close. A word of warning: You MUST read all the text, explore all the dialogue options, if you are to gain the most from the game. A decent intelligence and wisdom score is recommended.....although so is a decent score in everything else....the game does the best job of making usually superflous statistics genuinely useful that I have ever seen. Still very much worth playing.

Now this game may seem a little old and you may also think it's not that good just because of the graphics. But this game is pretty cool. Other then the fact that weapons are limited it'f practiacally all fun! You got cool modes example: The Hidden, Football/soccer (depending where you come from), original (yes this mode is just like playing the original Counter-Strike just so you know), Or even with zombies! There is even a crafting system! You can find gears and blueprints, Gears are used to choose how many days it will last (you dont actually choose, what i mean is that you can have 30 days gears, 2-5 days gears and 1 day gears), You also have blueprints. There are some grades of blueprints noted with a letter on the left, Higher the grade better chance of your craft being made (yes you can fail to craft a weapon if the blueprint has a low grade)  Hope this helped and don't get fooled by my playtime i absolutley love this game!

Better than COD: Ghosts  11/10 (Actual Review Below)  This is a spin-off of the very popular Counter-Strike series. At first it looks like Crossfire with the goldsrc engine. I'll go over the pros and cons.  Pros - It's free - It can run on crappy computers - Crafting gives you free temporary weapons - Classic CS action with zombie modes - Very popular  Cons - Pay to win - Unbalenced teams sometimes (eg: Ts are payers and CTs are f2ps) - Everyone camps in zombie mode - Menu is laggy on crappy computers - hackers (possibly)  Overall I give this an 7/10 It's not perfect but it's very fun in bite sized chunks.

The fortification mode was intresting, for the first couple of days, the crafting never worked even when the required materials were prestnt, and the 5th day titan never lost any health. I'm not a big stickler with graphics, but this is steam and you're using Counter-Strike as the foundamentals for your game, when source engion is free. There's also a store where you can spend 9 bucks to play as a women, 9 more if you want one on each team. The rest of the store have options that'll go away after 30 or 15 days. Ok this game is amazing. you may think 'oh counterstrike from 2001 or so it sucks!'. But let me stop you right there! This game has exceeded my expectations. Its not the original counterstrike. its way better! If your computer isnt that amazing but you love counterstrike and shooter games that dont lag. Well then this is your game. You can craft guns with blueprints in this game. And there are different guns added to the game. Every day or so you receive a daily bonus and a free weapon and booster i should say. Then you customize your classes and try out your new gun. One downside is that if you dont go on every day your progress will be lost but thats just the daily bonus not your overall stats and weapons. I would absolutely recommend you try this game out.

This is going to be a short review for only the most basics of my thoughts of the game. The game have limited potentials, plenty of bugs and glitches which makes the game unpleasent. Gameplay is casual, nothing special.  Issues with daily missions and special missions due to bugs such as kills not getting registered a lot of times. Is it pay to win? You can pay to win yes, you can buy the strongest weapons which will give you a huge adventage in Zombie or scenario mods.  Might have been better if instead of a Korean development team a Japanese team would have been choosen (would be less buggy). I would say it's good for practicing shooter games but not a competative game at all.

I think I gave this game a longer chance than most, but in the end I still can't recommend it. I would be able to look past the graphics if there was balanced gameplay to hold my attention. I could even forgive the limited-time crafted items in the freemium model if there was a reason to use them. Unfortunately, the game is a re-hash of typical FPS game modes without any polish.  I had hope for the couple of unique PVE modes but they were completely unbalanced in favor of the AI. Maybe it was unbalanced because I was playing with only one other friend, maybe it's meant for 4+ players, but I don't find that kind of balancing acceptable. Probably won't come back with more people to try again.

This game has a very narrow target audience, this is why it won't appeal to most CS players. It is targeted mostly towards Counter-Strike 1.6 Zombie Mode fanatics.  If you love playing Zombie Mode in the original CS 1.6, this might be your thing. Keep in mind that Nexon: Zombies is exactly that (CS 1.6 Zombie mode), but with a few improvements: The game has a lot more MMO-ish design than the original. Thankfully, the gameplay is largely unchanged. The biggest changes are in the UI and in the guns. The game also adds a ton of new Zombie Mode content. We're talking more maps, more modes etc. Unfortunately for some dumb reason, there are only TWO zombie models in the game.  If you don't enjoy CS 1.6 Zombie mode all that much, or just play the original modes, this is definitely not your thing. Players who play mostly bomb defusal scenarios will be hugely disappointed. There ARE classic bomb defusal and deathmatch modes, but they are just there for the sake of filling up the bullet-points.  Pros: + It's Free! AND it's NOT pay to win! + Freshens up the old and stale Counter-Strike formula a bit + New modes, or addition of modes which were not popular with the original CS. (Zombie escape is my personal favourite) + The maps are pretty dynamic for a 16 year old engine. + New guns + Several UI tweaks...  Cons: - ...which may alienate some of the hardcore fans. - The classic modes are a bummer. - Not much variety in terms of character customization (sprays, skins, etc.) - Toxic community. Like, League of Legends level of toxicity. - No modding community AT ALL - For a game that's primarily focused on zombies, the actual zombies themselves are pretty lame. I remember back in the day there were different types of zombies with different kinds of abilities (jumpers, healers, witches)... Instead, Nexon said 'F*ck all that' and gave us only TWO (!!!) zombie models.  Potato comparison: Imagine putting a potato in a cheap microwave for about a minute. When you take it out, some parts of the potato are blazing hot, while others are completely cold. This is what this game is like.  Final score: 6.8/10

There's a lot of things you need to get straight before you play this game. First being, the controls can be a little shoddy. More often than not, you'll find yourself having to click out of sniper scopes, or focus and unfocus because it doesn't undo that mechanic after you fire, and hit your target. I'm not sure why, but it sticks, and if there's a way to shut it off, I have yet to find it. I wouldn't suggest playing with bots. Finding a lobby with anyone is better than using the bots. Connections can be a bit wonky as well.     Once you get past that, their selection of weapons is pretty good for people who are just starting, and if you know how to use them, they're helpful in the field. I'm still not sure if you can even customize the character you play as aesthetically, but since it's a Nexon game, you'll probably have to pay for it.     The maps. And game modes. There's a lot to choose from, but some of them are painfully similar to others, and they just make very small editations to a few of them to make them 'entirely different' play styles. But they're kind of the same. Though, team deathmatches are pretty fun. The zombies are kind of original. I've not seen anything like them, in any other kind of game.    This is my first game review, so I can't say it's a fantastic one in means of detail.. so I'll condense it.   Pros:     - Good beginning weapon selection  - Frequent log in rewards   - Original infected ideas.  - Generously large maps.  - Nicely implimented music, and ambiance (map varying)  - Nice weapon SET selections.  - Server/room specifications are fair and thorough   Cons:     - OP bots *but usually, any and all bots are kind of OP.  - Occassionally glitchy mechanics  - Not very customizable.  - Server search/find could be easier to navigate.     6/10 Maybe 7 because it's FTP

NOTE: I have played 11 whole minutes of this, but who hasn’t. Imagine if the Counter Strike you all know and love today was turned into a crappy free to play game, now imagine that it got turned into a crappy zombie game, this is Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies. I saw this on the steam update news and thought that this was a crappy game from the reviews that it had been getting, but decided to play it anyway. How did Nexon even GET the license rights from Valve to make this pile of yesterday’s excrements? I bet they just walked up and said that they would promise it would be a 'good' game, Valve probably said no and Nexon must have made it anyway. Oh also, these guys attempted to make Counter-Strike Online 1 & 2, however they failed to notice that Counter-Strike is already an online game. Enough rambling on from me, time to talk about this game. This game is for people who either want the nostalgic feel of old CS, or for the ever-so-overused zombies. When you start this game you get about 7 popups stating that you got all of these items and its good for some reason, but I don’t want all this crap in games, I just want to play the actual game. After you configure some things in the settings and all that, you can finally enter the game. So far I saw that there are two game modes: Classic CS, and zombies. Classic CS is what you guessed, good old CS in a crappy game. The zombies game mode is pretty self-explanatory, waves of zombies swarm at you like ants to sugar while you sit back and fire bullets at them until raspberry jam spills out of their wounds. Good luck trying to make your way around when the zombies circle around you and you're out of bullets. I also saw that there is a crappy crafting system implemented into this game, it's always crafting and zombies now days isn't it? I have no idea what credits do, I assume it works like the system in Blacklight: Retribution, where you rent the gun for a few days for a 'bit' of your money that is shoved into your face when you start. I also saw some laggy pre-rendered videos of counter-terrorists shooting some zombies or aliens or whatever. There was also an ad on the side that said something along the lines of 'Play today and get rewards', and had the 'sex appeal', as in a woman with a bra visibly shown and a coat on or something. It's funny how the game advertises this and shows a woman in some raunchy outfit, yet there appears to be no female character in the game, sexism at its finest. To wrap this up, it's the typical modern day shooter/zombie/crafting/crappy interface/free to play game, and before you install it, you should uninstall it.

Not many zombies... not many zombies... let's start off this review with the most riveting sentence ever. Spooky, scary skeletons! Alright, now let me explain. This game has a very old feel to it, and in my opinion, that's good! When I play this game, I can truly say, 'I'm playing the original counter strike right now.' Wanna know why? Cause It's EXACTLY like the first counter strike! EXACTLY. There are barely any zombies and I sure as hell don't remember any samurai swords. What I'm trying to say is that cs:nz has a special cs:go-ish feel to it in the menu, but in the actual gameplay it has a special cs:s feel to it. I've never seen any zombies or any extremely wierd guns but then again, I've only played it for a couple hours so far. When you shoot someone in this game, your rewarded with an explosion of blood, and whenever you kill someone, you hear a deep, loud voice say 'ONE KILL!' And a thing pops up on your screen that says '1 KILL' so when you become a boss at this game and your killing everyone, you will feel proud of yourself. That leads me to my next point as when you first play the game, you instantly become a pro, and I mean INSTANTLY. Ok, maybe not instantly, but after a while. I would highly recommend this game that in all is fun, addicting, distracting, awesome, bloody, amazing and just downright fun.(oh, crap, i already said 'fun') It's free and awesome, all ready to go for anyone who has the fortune to stumble apon this game in the steam store. Enjoy killing people on the internet, and have a good day!

So, it was a good game, but really, I didn't like it. It had the classic Counter-Strike graphics and gamemodes, a 'Zombie' gamemode which was pretty much TDM but the 'Terrorist' team was replaced by 'Zombie' and only had melee. Second, I could not play this in fullscreen. AT ALL. It just minimizes and won't open. I probably can't do my Age of Reckoning trick, so I play windowed. Also, the main title screen is pretty much just one of those 'Buy guns, go play' kind. Also, they give you 900000000 (sarcasm) points, which do a few things but really, most actually GOOD and USEFUL things cost REAL money. I ain't gonna dish out my dosh for a character skin that is $9.99 and has no other features. I ain't gonna dish out the dosh if this gun costs $4.99 for 1 day. Also, there is a glitch where you only do headshots until you get banned from the server for a month. WTF?! So, only download this game for the CS game modes, because most weapons from it are free at the start for a lifetime. AK, M16, Dual Berettas etc.  EDIT: Whoops, I forgot the final verdict.  4.3/10.
